headline: Amphenol Gets an Upgrade. There’s More to the Story Than AI Data Centers.
summary: Shares of  Amphenol  the maker of fiber-optic cables and connectors, have surged 81% this year.  BofA  Securities upgraded Amphenol to Buy from Neutral on Wednesday, raising its target for the stock price to $150 from $120.  Artificial intelligence is “driving interconnect demand even higher,” the bank said.

BofA  Securities upgraded Amphenol to Buy from Neutral on Wednesday, raising its target for the stock price to $150 from $120.  Artificial intelligence is “driving interconnect demand even higher,” the bank said.

headline: Waymo Is Going to London. Alphabet Stock Is Up.
summary: Self-driving cars are expanding rapidly across the nation—and now across the pond.  On Wednesday,  Alphabet’s  robo-taxi business Waymo announced plans to start a fully autonomous ride-hailing service in London in 2026.  Today, Waymo operates in Phoenix; San Francisco; Los Angeles; Austin, Texas; and Atlanta.

headline: Volatility Shares files for the first ever potential 5X leveraged ETF in the US
summary: (Reuters) -Volatility Shares, an issuer of exchange-traded funds, filed on Wednesday to launch a total of 27 highly leveraged ETFs, including the first-ever proposed 5x ETF for the U.S. market, at a time of rising caution over inflated asset prices as markets continue their upward swing.  Volatility Shares has filed for a 3x and a 5x offering on Strategy, where existing issuers have struggled to manage a 2x product.  Until now, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has approved single-stock leveraged ETFs with a maximum of 2x.

Volatility Shares has filed for a 3x and a 5x offering on Strategy, where existing issuers have struggled to manage a 2x product.  Until now, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has approved single-stock leveraged ETFs with a maximum of 2x.
